getObjectByIndex
The function returns an object by a unique index or an array of objects if the given index is not unique.
Syntax
getObjectByIndex
(typeObj, key, [attrKey : keyValue], attr)
Setting
Purpose
typeObj
The object type whose object should be returned.
key
Previously selected
Key
object type
attrKey
The attribute (or set of attributes) that makes up the
key
.
keyValue
The value of the attribute (or set of attributes) of the key that will be used to search the object.
attr
The attribute(s) of the selected object type. The attributes are enumerated separated by commas.
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in the Algorithm Editor on the "Objects" tab.
A modal window opens to select:
object type in the "Type" field;
key in the "Index" field;
type attributes in the table of the same name.
Example
It is necessary to return the " Auto Dealer" type object, containing information about the car brand, price and offer relevance according to the given VIN of the car. The algorithm will take the following form:
When calling the getObjectByIndex function, the parameters are defined via the opened modal window according to the conditions of the task.
Then, the VIN value is set as the keyValue parameter (for example, the string value "SJNBAAN16UO411167").
